title: Kizaru as Secret Ally of the Straw Hats
author: Various One Piece fans
theory: Admiral Kizaru has been secretly acting as a guardian figure to the Straw Hat Pirates and may eventually betray the Marines to join their allies. Similar to Itachi Uchiha from Naruto, Kizaru has been working from within the system while protecting those he cares about.

evidence.description: During the Sabaody Archipelago arc, Kizaru had enough time to kill the Straw Hats before Rayleigh arrived, but he did not do so. He also did not stop Kuma from disbanding the Straw Hats or chase the pirates to kill them for hitting a Celestial Dragon.

During the Paramount War, Kizaru always avoided hurting Luffy. There were several moments when Luffy went up against him, but every time, he would come out unscathed. Kizaru could have easily killed him but refrained from doing it.

Recent episodes provide nuance to Kizaru's character, hinting that he could end up changing sides. It's likely that Kizaru slowly began to resent the World Government for what they did to Kuma, and his work ethic significantly deteriorated after Kuma was made a Warlord.

counterArguments.argument: Kizaru's apparent restraint could simply be his laid-back personality and not a sign of secret allegiance.
As an Admiral, Kizaru has consistently followed Marine orders and has never shown explicit signs of rebellion.

communityReception: The theory remains speculative and is debated within the One Piece fandom. While interesting parallels exist, concrete evidence is limited.

culturalReferences.description: The theory draws parallels to Itachi, who secretly protected his brother while appearing to be a villain.
